content: Is there a way to get a tabbed menu with more than two levels?

Depends on what you need. If the items have to be MENU_DEFAULT_LOCAL_TASK, MENU_LOCAL_TASK ... - not that I knew. But you can create anything, for instance a custom menu block or something with views and style it the way you need it.
Thanks @indigoxela That's what I was thinking.

I cannot make this work. I want to make a complex menu structure under 'node/%node/mymodule'. I cannot render them as local tasks as there is a limit of two levels. I cannot create a custom menu and assign a menu_name to each menu item, and render the menu block as tabs, because the menu items don't appear in the block. I guess the only way to do this is by creating a custom block which prints the links list without depending on the menu.inc. Any other ideas? Thanks.

@Robert Garrigos Maybe someone comes with a fancy idea, if you describe your use case a bit. Currently we only realise that you insist on the "things" to be primary/secondary tabs, but it's unclear why this is essential for you.

thanks @indigoxela I 'm not explaining myself well enough.

I realize that I cannot set any menu item below 'node/%' as normal item. They have to be local tasks as the parents are local task.

Then I tried to create my own menu 'mymodule-menu' and add menu items to it, through hook_menu, as normal items like 'mymodule/%node/mytask'. The intention is to print a menu block and stylize it as tabs. But my links don't appear in the menu if they use the %node wildcard. (a menu item 'mymodule/mytask' gets indeed printed)

What am I missing??
Finally, found what I was missing: a _to_arg() function. Now my menu block shows all my custom links with argument wildcards.

It is already documented on https://api.backdropcms.org/api/backdrop/core%21modules%21system%21system.api.php/function/hook_menu/1 but there is only one implementation in the whole core system and one in backdrop-contrib (webform).
